meanings.definition: The act of transporting goods by wagon.
meanings.sent1: The wagonage of the heavy boxes was tiring for the horses.
meanings.sent2: The wagonage of the farm produce was essential for delivering it to the market.
meanings.sent3: The wagonage of the circus animals made the journey seem like a fun adventure.
meanings.sent4: The wagonage of memories carried by the old wagon traveled through time.
meanings.sent5: The wagonage of colorful balloons added a festive touch to the parade.

meanings.definition: The charge for transporting goods by wagon.
meanings.sent1: The fair wagonage for moving the furniture was reasonable.
meanings.sent2: The wagonage for shipping goods across the country varied depending on the distance.
meanings.sent3: The high wagonage for carrying the rare artifacts surprised the travelers.
meanings.sent4: The wagonage for dreams delivered by the wagon was priceless.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected wagonage for the antique vase raised eyebrows at the auction.
